FuncDef: The multicast deny-vlan command enables the function of filtering out multicast data packets in a VLAN on an interface. The undo multicast deny-vlan command disables an interface from filtering out multicast data packets in a VLAN. By default, an interface forwards received multicast data packets. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K and CE6820S.
ParentView: Layer 2 100GE interface view,Layer 2 10GE interface view,Layer 2 200GE interface view,25GE-L2 view,400GE-L2 view,Layer 2 50GE interface view,Layer 2 Eth-Trunk interface view,Layer 2 GE interface view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the start VLAN ID.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 4094.

Indicates the end VLAN ID.
The value is an integer. The value ranges from 1 to 4094. By default, the value is null.

ExtraInfo: After the multicast deny-vlan command is run on an interface, the interface discards the received multicast packets from the specified VLANs. This function may be used in the following scenarios:
